growthexperiments-desc: This extension contains experiments done by the Growth team.
growthexperiments-config-validator-addit: The new config has config keys that cannot be customized here.
growthexperiments-config-validator-datat: $1 is expected to be $2, but is $3
growthexperiments-config-validator-conte: Content-model mismatch: GrowthExperiments config file must have JSON content model, $1 detected
growthexperiments-config-validator-newco: Invalid task type handler ID: $1 is not a valid value
growthexperiments-edit-config-last-edit-: [[$2]]: Last updated by unknown user $1 ([$3 diff]).
growthexperiments-edit-config-pretext: This page allows you to edit configuration of [[:mw:Special:MyLanguage/Growth|Growth]] team features. It will edit $1 on your behalf. You can see your changes in the page history of that page.
growthexperiments-edit-config-pretext-ba: {{GENDER:|You}} can also display a banner on the newcomer homepage, to include announcement about events important to newcomers. If {{GENDER:|you}} want to do so, {{GENDER:|you}} need to add it to [[$1]] manually. Any content added there will be displayed in a yellow banner at the top of [[Special:Homepage]].
growthexperiments-edit-config-pretext-un: This form allows privileged users to edit configuration of [[:mw:Special:MyLanguage/Growth|Growth]] team features.
growthexperiments-edit-config-feedback-h: Do you have ideas or questions about this form?
growthexperiments-edit-config-error-inva: Configuration page was not configured properly
growthexperiments-edit-config-config-cha: Configuration was changed. You might need to wait for a few minutes for the changes to take effect.
growthexperiments-edit-config-return-to-: You can [[Special:EditGrowthConfig|return back]] to the editing form.
growthexperiments-edit-config-help-panel: Help panel settings

The help panel can be available in any namespace, in reading or edit mode, as configured below. It includes the ability to search for help, click help links, and ask questions to either mentors or to the help desk.
Namespaces where the help panel is available in reading mode
Namespaces with the help panel disabled in both reading and editing mode
Help desk page where questions should be posted from the help panel.
Where on the help desk page should new questions be posted?
Top of page
Bottom of page
Destination page for "View more help articles"
Namespaces to include in the help panel's free text search for help
Where should questions from the help panel be directed?
Mentor talk pages
Help desk
Help panel links
The help panel displays five links and one "view more" link. These can be configured to be any links in the wiki, but recommendations are included below.
1) Destination page for first help panel link (recommended: manual of style)
1) Label of first help panel link (recommended: "Manual of Style")
2) Destination page for second help panel link (recommended: visual editor guide)
2) Label of second help panel link (recommended: "How to edit")
3) Destination page for third help panel link (recommended: inserting images with visual editor)
3) Label of third help panel link (recommended: "How to insert images")
4) Destination page for fourth help panel link (recommended: inserting references with visual editor)
4) Label of fourth help panel link (recommended: "How to add a reference")
5) Destination page for fifth help panel link (recommended: article wizard)
5) Label of fifth help panel link (recommended: "How to create an article")
growthexperiments-edit-config-homepage-i: Destination page for a link about how create a new article
Destination page for a link about how to add images in the visual editor
growthexperiments-edit-config-mentorship: Wikis can have two separate mentor lists: one for mentors that get randomly assigned to all newcomers, and another for mentors that do not get randomly assigned, but can claim mentees. This second list is used for mentors that only want to be mentors to people from events or classes.
Page containing list of mentors to be automatically assigned to newcomers
Page containing list of mentors that can only be assigned manually
growthexperiments-edit-config-newcomer-t: Some types of suggested edits are surfaced through maintenance templates. Articles containing those templates are added to the feed. To see how many articles are available for each type of task, see [[Special:NewcomerTasksInfo|this page]].
Copy editing: templates to find articles that need copy editing, such as spelling, grammar, and punctuation improvements.
Destination page for learning more about copy editing.
Expand: templates to find articles that need expansion.
Destination page for learning more about expanding articles.
Links: templates to find articles that need more links.
Destination page for learning more about adding links.
References: templates to find articles that need more references.
Destination page for learning more about adding references.
Update: templates to find articles that need to be updated with current information.
Destination page for learning more about updating articles.
Destination page for learning more about link recommendation task type.
Destination page for learning more about image recommendation task type.
This task type is associated with machine suggestions, and does not use templates to generate a pool of tasks.
Articles containing templates defined here will not be shown to users as tasks for this task type.
Articles containing categories defined here will not be shown to users as tasks for this task type.

These templates are needed for the [[mw:Growth/Personalized_first_day/Structured_tasks/Add_an_image|image suggestions]] newcomer task feature. Articles containing these templates will not be listed as image suggestion tasks.
